intro: Chromatotriccum juncoideum, commonly known as the golden thread, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense mats on the ground. Chromatotriccum juncoideum is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
